ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.

What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Generally how to process images via Matlab and the mathematical theory behind it.

The class does a good job of teaching applications of image processing. You learn a lot of things ranging from how to apply discrete Fourier analysis to images and also how to detect features in images.
I learned about various methods for image analysis from machine learning, to image registration, to fourier transforms and convolution.
I learned mathematical approaches to analyzing biomedical images.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would ask that more of the course was focused on actually processing images. I really enjoyed the coding assignments where we read in images and changed their features.
The course is good with theory and application question in the psets. The professors also were very responsive to emails and questions.

I love the professors (Duncan and Staib) that teach this class! They are attentive and care about their students. Between the two of them they do a great survey of many topics and their tests and homework assignments are fair. 
My biggest issue with the course was that the lectures and readings were often very high level. Lots of concepts and hand wavey steps but very little actual example applications which made try to apply concepts on the homeworks and in code pretty challenging.
I liked that two professors taught the course.  I think that the handwritten notes could have been more neatly written though.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I thought the virtual lectures were very well done. I really appreciated how the professors effectively used the iPad to take notes and write important concepts.
I mean this was just a typical lecture course and so they did synchronous online lectures and open-note take home tests. Everything worked seamlessly -- No complaints and no improvements to offer.
I thought this course did well.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: It is a good course, but I do wish it had more of a focus on actually processing images. There is a fair amount of math about the theory of processing images, but I still learned something and felt it was a useful course!
Yes! If not just for Prof Duncan and Staib, then for the breadth of topics covered.
Yes, I would recommend this for anyone interested in AI/ML or image processing.
